text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Minya Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Flag of Minya Governorate.jpg | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Coat of arms of Minya Govenorate.JPG | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Minya in Egypt.svg | map_caption = Minya Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = Minya (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 32,279 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 5807000 | population_as_of = March 2019 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = }} Minya Governorate is a governorate of Egypt. The capital city is also named Minya. Minya has one of the highest concentration of Coptic Christians in Egypt (approximately 50% of total population). ==Cities== As of 2018, 10 cities (or towns) in Minya had a population of over 15,000 people. *Abu Qirqas *El Idwa *Minya *New Minya *Beni Mazar *Deir Mawas *Maghagha *Mallawi *Matai *Samalut == References == Category:Governorates of Egypt
title: Minya Governorate
